trans-unit.source: Represents the `union` element for simple types from XML Schema as specified by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C).
A `union` datatype can be used to specify the content of a `simpleType`.
The value of the `simpleType` element must be any one of a set of alternative datatypes specified in the union.
Union types are always derived types and must comprise at least two alternative datatypes.
A `union` type enables an element or attribute value to be one or more instances of one type drawn from the union of multiple atomic and list types.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleTypeUnion"></xref> class.

Gets an array of <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleType"></xref> objects representing the type of the `simpleType` element based on the <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleTypeUnion.BaseTypes"></xref> and <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleTypeUnion.MemberTypes"></xref> values of the simple type.
This property is a post-schema-compilation-infoset property.
An array of <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleType"></xref> objects representing the type of the `simpleType` element.
Gets the collection of base types.
The collection of simple type base values.
Gets or sets the array of qualified member names of built-in data types or `simpleType` elements defined in this schema (or another schema indicated by the specified namespace).
An array that consists of a list of members of built-in data types or simple types.
